content.label: I absolutely love this game and have since its release before iOS, That being said it gets a one star solely because the app got deleted from a family member and I was on my way to the final boss, I re downloaded the game and there are no save profiles and I refuse to start that much over. As I said amazing game, story, and graphically wise, just don't delete it and feel as bad as I do.
I need Korean
I didn't want to review the game until I was able to go all the way through. After beating the game, It seems flawless. Controls were easy, graphics were great, and I wouldn't change a thing!

title.label: Three major changes need to be made

content.label: This game needs three things and it'll be complete: auto battle, icloud support, and ipad compatibility. The fact that it is necessary to buy the game on both iphone and ipad is both stupid and greedy. Fix these things and the game will be 5/5

I know the original didn't have an auto battle feature but I would love to have something like that added to the game!  It would make it much quicker to battle lower level enemies in the game!  Please add this feature for a 5 star rating!  Still a fun game!
So far the game has run fine for me (iPhone 6s iOS 9.2) and is an excellent port!

There is absolutely no sound. I could still play it but who doesn't love the FF musical score?
iPhone5c
With the recent update the game is flawless

This is a review about the port, not the game proper.  It is frustrating that some of the games in the series (i.e., I, IV, VI, VII) are compatible on both iPad and iPhone and include iCloud saving features while other games in the series (II, III, Tactics, Chrono Trigger) do not work on both machines.  Worse still, Final Fantasy III and Tactics must be purchased twice if you want to play it on both devices.  This should be fixed (and iCloud enabled) for these games.

You did great fixing this game but you need to go in order. People have been complaining about FF2 and 1 WAY longer then this one. You need to fix those games really bad. But this is about FFIII so I give it 5-5 for at least doing something. 👍🏼 keep up the good work!
Works great, I'm not experiencing any of the crashes reported. I'm on iPhone 6 with iOS 9.1. A great classic
As many other people have said. The game keeps crashing.
I love this game to death, but every time I use an item when not in a conflict, the game crashes... That is absolutely detrimental to the way this game should function.

title.label: Not a universal app, unlike rest of FF series

content.label:
Very disappointed in having to pay $15+ twice to be able to play FF3 on iPad and iPhone. This seems to be the only non-universal Final Fantasy on the App Store. Such a pity.

Add to this the iOS 9 bugs and you end up with a colossal waste of money.
Keeps crashing every time getting out of inventory
Can't beat the gnome village part because I can't access my inventory items without the game crashing.
Crashes when I use items. Frustrating to play. Please update. Thanks

I was really enjoying this game until I got to the Crystal Tower...and upgraded to iOS 9. I can't use any inventory items without the game crashing, and any RPG player knows that it's IMPOSSIBLE to get through the last dungeons without access to the inventory. Great game but I can't finish it, extremely frustrating.
After downloading the new iOS 9.0, this game now quits whenever I use an item from the inventory screen.
Since update anytime I try to apply anything to the Arc character the game shuts down tried to reinstall still does same thing. Great game just wish I could play it.

title.label: Great but needs minor bug fix

content.label: Great game thus far, but ive noticed sometimes when I start the app, the music is not playing. I still hear sound effects, but no music. It only happens occasionally, please fix. Great gameplay otherwise!!

SE's updates are always long overdue, which has definitely curbed my enthusiasm for their iOS titles. It would be nice to see the remaining SE titles optimized for the latest devices and coded for universal play (with iCloud support) as well.
I enjoy the game from beginning to end!
I never could play the nes version TwT , because only was in japanese, and dowload this and... See this beautiful world ;w; . This game must be named "remake"

I have had this up for a while now on my iPhone and the problem that I have occurred was from the future update where they have White Borders now which seems a little distracting while playing the game as well as the D pad virtual D pad that is is a little bit large in my opinion update this so that it fits the iPhone 6+ screen and get rid of the white borders tweak the D pad a little bit make it a little bit more less noticeable

title.label: If you missed the DS port 👌🏽

content.label: Graphically the same as the DS version, but streamlined for one screen.  Gameplay came together really nice, and it was awesome that you didn't need friends to unlock Onion Knight Job 👍🏽

Nearly a year and no updates. Nasty multitasking crash bug when trying to resume the game.

Wish SE would stop being lazy and fix some bugs...

I love this game and would give it 5 stars except that every time I get an alert on my phone the game restarts. This really is a pain when you have put an hour+ into a level and are fighting a boss only to have a reminder, or other alert pop up and find you are back at the title screen with all progress since last save lost after clearing the alert. I have not had this issue with other FF games on my phone. Please fix!

I like final fantasy
This is best RPG
but...
Korean support plz~~
I want to Korean patch...

Spent 80 hours on this game over the last few months and it was well worth it. Possibly my favorite in the FF series apart from Tactics and Square Enix did a great job updating the animations for this iOS version. Apart from a minor issue where the game occasionally crashes from phone alerts / sitting idle, it worked very well. Save often and start preparing now to face the Iron Giant!
No support for iPhone 6 plus. Love the game been a fan. Wish it wouldn't crash when I pull down the notifications bar. Other than that it works great. Please update!
I do like the retro graphics and RPG styling, but no sound on my iPhone 6+ after iOS update.
Come out with final fantasy 7 that was my favorite one out of all of them.

I never played the Final Fantasy games when I was younger and they first came out state-side. On a whim (and looking for a way to waste time :) I downloaded the iOS port of FF I a couple of years ago. What a great game! And I could see why this series has endured for so long. FF II built on the first beautifully.

Recently, I downloaded the 3rd installment. I really appreciate the shift to 3D, the great gameplay, fun story, tongue-in-cheek humor, etc. I haven’t been able to put it down since I downloaded it and that’s not something I can say about most games I try out from the App Store.

The reason I’m not giving this a higher review is the fact that the game crashes so frequently. In the middle of a huge battle and get a phone call? Buh-bye; try again after the game quits to the Home screen and you have to wait through the splash screen and continue/load from a point before the battle. I see the game was updated in June of ’14 to address this sort of thing. But quite a lot has happened between then and now including iOS 8, iPhone 6/6+ and so forth.

I think Square-Enix is a great game-making company. But they seem to follow what can be considered an old model: develop a game and release it into the wild for better or worse. It’s great they’re occasionally updating games to fix issues and bugs, but not nearly frequently enough for the ever-evolving iOS platform. To the best of my knowledge, FF I & FF II are still letterboxed for pre-iPhone 5 screens (3.5”). Likewise FF Tactics. And I paid over $10 each for these games! Yeah, the content and quality justify that cost, but not SE’s seeming lack of attention to their product. I still get attention and updates to apps I paid $0.99 or nothing for, years after their original release. Sure, they are usually (but not always) nowhere near the complexity and quality of the FF series, but I’m not left wondering if every update is going to be the last, forever stuck in 3.5” screen, 32 bit whatever.

Please, Square Enix, continue to show love for your games. You’ve started to by re-releasing for different platforms, but we iOS gamers would love more attention to your ports!

I played the Nintendo DS version of this game a while back but never finished it, so I decided to pick it back up on iOS during a 50% off sale. Definitely worth it. All of the classic Final Fantasy games are a joy to play, so if you catch them on sale don't hesitate and get a few titles. You will be glad.

title.label: Love the game, but has some problems

content.label:
First off, I love this game and the control implementation is wonderful. That said, this game has a few things pushing against it:
1- two different versions of the game, one for iPad and one for iPhone. I purchased the iPhone one because it's compatible with both, but still that's kinda weak. I'd rather be able to access full resolution of my iPad instead of scaling it without having to buy the app again. Many developers have shown that this is possible. 
2- price is a bit steep for an iOS app. 
3- cloud saves I started on my iPad are not being picked up on my iPhone. No idea why this is but it is very unfortunate, kinda ruins the whole point of mobile gaming considering I want to play on any device any time. 

3 stars because price for quality is a bit lacking. It makes a few promises that it hasn't backed up for me yet.
I payed 17 dollars for this game and received a different game. I want what I payed for PLEASE RESOLVE THIS!!!

I purchased the handle that included this game not too long ago. This is the iPhone version, not the iPad version. I am not about to buy another version of this game to play it on the iPad. If I had known this I would never have purchased the bundle. Their other titles are available on both platforms once you purchase either, but not this one. Consistency seems to be an issue here. If you want this game on the iPad, then avoid this bundle.

I may change this if I decide to play this one more time but the first two times I've played I stepped into a zone where things were too strong for me and I died. Quick save didn't save and for some reason nothing saved in my cloud when I saved. The inn didn't save either so for now 0/5 because if you can't keep your progress what is the point

I love this game so much that even after losing my file on the final boss after updating my phone, I will still give it 5 stars. If you were thinking about whether or not to get this game stop thinking, and get it. SE just needs iCloud saves.

I'm a huge fan of Final Fantasy, and I think III is my favorite in the franchise. I've bought this app twice now (lost access to my last iTunes account) but I have no regrets buying it again. $16 well spent.

title.label: I am a final fantasy fan even final fantasy III

content.label: Final fantasy III is amazing RPG to have on iPad or iPhone. FF III is a first game that you can change to different jobs like black Mage, thief, white Mage or a warlock. There is lot more jobs to change to this is more similar to FF V even the fore crystals of light. You put icloud on this app too thank you square enix to put FF III on apps store.*****  I would suggest that you guys should buy this game this is amazing game even other final fantasy series here on apps store. I'm promise you that this game is amazing.:-) :-) :-) :-) :-)
Love this game and the series in general bug where the heck are the iCloud saves? Come on SE!
Keeps getting better a little at a time...
One of the harder games in the series in my opinion but loved it!!!

This game has had more than its share of bugs, but just as I'm about to give up on it, they release an update. I never got the chance to play the original release of FFIII or the NDS port so the price tag on the app didn't seem too steep. Like I said, there has been a lot of kinks in the works, but the developers are still releasing updates to address the issues. The game itself is brilliant and (hopefully, after this most recent update) flawless.
I love this one A lot more than the other final fantasy before #3 because of the jobs
This is an amazing game. At first i was nervous about buying it but it was totally worth the money! I also think square enix should add final fantasy adventure to the App Store

please do make the text of every final fantasy UNIFORM. It's so annoying, it looks like this:

Final Fantasy 
Final FantasyII
FINALFANTASY3
FinalFantasy4
FinalFantasy5

It's doesn't look neat.

I have never played a game on a mobile device as fun as this! The game had such a long story and it felt like it would never end. When the story ended the game wasn't over because I could still try to level everyone up to maximum level and that was fun by itself. I can't forget to mention the onion knight. I have always been a fan of the onion knight, he is like the best character if u level him up. At times the game can get really hard, but the story is worth it. Does anyone else have any recommendations on which final fantasy game I should get next? I like how this was 3-D and I dont really like the 2-D ones...
